clinical_study.brief_title: Retigabine Efficacy and Safety Trial for Partial Onset Refractory Seizures in Epilepsy
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Multicenter, Parallel-Group Phase 3 Study - Determine Efficacy and Safety of Two Doses of Retigabine (900 Mg/Day and 600 Mg/Day) Used as Adjunctive Therapy in Refractory Epilepsy Patients With Partial-Onset Seizures

brief_summary.textblock: This Phase 3 study is being conducted to evaluate the efficacy and safety of retigabine dosed at 900 mg/day and 600 mg/day, in three equally divided doses, compared with placebo in patients with epilepsy who are receiving up to three established antiepileptic drugs (AEDs).

detailed_description.textblock: This Phase 3 study is being conducted in Europe, Israel, Australia, and South Africa to evaluate the efficacy and safety of retigabine dosed at 900 mg/day and 600 mg/day, in three equally divided doses, compared with placebo in patients with epilepsy who are receiving up to three established antiepileptic drugs (AEDs). The primary objective is to demonstrate a superior change in total partial seizure frequency for four weeks from baseline to the double-blind period. The proportion of responders (greater than or equal to 50% reduction in seizure frequency for four weeks from baseline to the double-blind period) will also be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in the 28-day Total Partial Seizure (PS) Frequency From Baseline (BL) to the End of the Double-blind (DB) Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Week -7 through Week 0), DB Phase (Week 1 through Week 16)
primary_outcome.description: 28-day total PS (PSs [also called focal seizures] are seizures limited to a specific area of the brain) frequency in the BL period = (Number [No.] of total PSs reported in the BL period divided by the No. of days of available total PS data in the BL period) x 28 days. 28-day total PS frequency in the DB period = (No. of total PSs reported in the DB period divided by the No. of days of available total PS data in the DB period) x 28 days. Percent change = ([value in the DB period minus value at BL] divided by the BL value) x 100%. Negative valu es indicate a reduction in seizure frequency.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Classified as Responders and Non-responders During the Maintenance Phase
primary_outcome.description: Responders were participants with at least a 50% reduction in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency in the Maintenance Phase as compared to the Baseline period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were Responders and Non-responders During the DB Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Responders were participants with at least a 50% reduction in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency in the DB Phase as compared to the Baseline period. Participants without any post-baseline data were considered non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline (BL) in the 28-day Total Partial Seizure Frequency During the Maintenance Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Week -7 through Week 0), Week 5 through Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: 28-day total partial seizure frequency in the BL period = (No. of total partial seizures reported in the BL period divided by the No. of days of available total partial seizure data in the BL period) x 28 days. 28-day total partial seizure frequency in the Maintenance Phase = (No. of total partial seizures reported in the Maintenance Phase divided by the No. of days of available total partial seizure data in the same phase) x 28 days. Percent change = (value in the Maintenance Phase minus value at BL divided by the BL value) x 100%. Negative values indicate a reduction in seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Reduction in the 28-day Total Partial Seizure Frequency From Baseline to the End of DB Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases) by Indicated Quartile Reduction Categories
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Week -7 through Week 0), Week 1 through Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who experienced a reduction from Baseline in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency were categorized as having a reduction of 75-100%, 50-<75%, 25-<50%, or <25%, in addition to having no reduction. This quartile cutting was specified in the study protocol. Participants without any post-baseline data are included in the "No reduction" category.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Reduction in the 28-day Total Partial Seizure Frequency From Baseline to the DB Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases) by Indicated Decile Reduction and Increase Categories
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Week -7 through Week 0), Week 1 through Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who experienced a reduction from Baseline in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency were categorized in decile cutting, i.e., reduction categories of 90-100%, 80-<90%, 70-<80%, 60-<70%, 50-<60%, 40-<50%, 30-<40%, 20-<30%, 10-<20%, >0-<10%, and increase categories of 0-10%, >10-20%, >20-30%, >30% (FDA endpoint). Participants without any post-baseline data were included in the category 0-10% increase category.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With the Indicated Reduction From Baseline in the 28-day Total Partial Seizure Frequency During the Maintenance Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Week -7 through Week 0), Week 5 through Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who experienced a reduction from Baseline in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency were categorized as having a >75%, a 50-75%, or a <50% reduction, in addition to having no reduction (EMEA endpoint).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced the Indicated Level of Exacerbation and Reduction in the 28-day Total Partial Seizure Frequency From Baseline During the Maintenance Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Week -7 through Week 0), Week 5 through Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who experienced an exacerbation from Baseline in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency were categorized as having a 0-25% or a >25% increase (EMEA endpoint). The number of participants experiencing a >0% reduction from Baseline in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency are also presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting New Seizure Types in the Indicated Categories During the DB Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases) That Were Not Reported at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Week -7 through Week 0), Week 1 through Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: New seizure types included those seizures which were not reported by any participant at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were Seizure-free During the DB Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were considered to be seizure-free if they had not reported any seizures during the DB treatment period (Weeks 1-18). For a participant to be seizure free during the DB Phase, the participant had to be seizure free both Week 7 to Week 18 and Week 1 to Week 6. A participant could be seizure free Week 7 to Week 18 (during the Maintenance Phase), but not seizure free Week 1 to Week 6. Hence, there are fewer participants being reported as seizure free from Week 1 to Week 18 than from Week 7 to Week 18.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were Seizure-free During the Maintenance Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were considered to be seizure-free if they had not reported any seizures during the Maintenance Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Seizure-free Days During the DB Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases)
secondary_outcome.description: A seizure-free day was a day without any seizures. For a participant to be seizure free during the DB Phase, the participant had to be seizure free both Week 7 to Week 18 and Week 1 to Week 6. A participant could be seizure free Week 7 to Week 18 (during the Maintenance Phase), but not seizure free Week 1 to Week 6. Hence, there are fewer participants being reported as seizure free from Week 1 to Week 18 than from Week 7 to Week 18. The percentage of seizure-free days was calculated as the total number of days without seizures in the DB period divided by the number of days in DB period x 100%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Seizure-free Days During the Maintenance Phase
secondary_outcome.description: A seizure-free day was a day without any seizures. The percentage of seizure-free days was calculated as the total number of days without seizures in the Maintenance Phase divided by the number of days in the Maintenance Phase x 100%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) Score at the End of the Maintenance Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression of Improvement (CGI-I) is a 7-point scale that requires the clinician to assess how much the participant's illness has improved or worsened relative to a baseline state at the beginning of the treatment. Scores on the scale are rated as: 1, very much improved; 2, much improved; 3, minimally improved; 4, no change; 5, minimally worse; 6, much worse; or 7, very much worse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression (PGI) Score at the End of the Maintenance Phase
secondary_outcome.description: PGI is a participant-rated scale of improvement that was administered at the end of the Maintenance Phase in order to assess the participant's impression of his or her own improvement. PGI assessments were scored using a 7-point scale: 1, very much improved; 2, much improved; 3, minimally improved; 4, no change; 5, minimally worse; 6, much worse; or 7, very much worse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Assessed by Quality of Life in Epilepsy-Problems Questionnaire (QOLIE-31-P) at BL (Week 0) and Weeks 4, 8, and 16
secondary_outcome.description: The QOLIE-31-P is a 31-item questionnaire evaluating a participant's QOL perception in 7 domains: seizure worry, emotional well being, energy/fatigue, cognitive functioning, medication effects, social functioning, overall QOL. Precoded numeric values for some domains are such that a higher number reflects a more favorable health state; others are such that a higher number reflects a less favorable state. Precoded values are first converted to 0-100 point scores; higher converted scores always reflect better QOL. The overall score is derived by weighting and then summing the 7 domain scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Whose Clinical Laboratory Values Were Deemed an Adverse Event by the Investigator (>=2% in Any Treatment Arm)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically important changes in laboratory values were to be reported as an adverse event if they met one of the following criteria: (1) intervention required; (2) change in dose of study drug required; (3) other treatment/therapy required; (4) association with other diagnoses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Reported the Indicated Renal and Urinary Disorder Adverse Events at a Frequency Threshold of 2% (in Any Treatment Arm)
secondary_outcome.description: A summary of the adverse events classified as renal or urinary disorders and in which at least 2% (rounded to an integer) of participants in any treatment arm reported during the study is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Post-void Residual Urine Volume at Weeks 8 and 16 of the Maintenance Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Post-void residual (PVR) urine refers to the amount of urine remaining in the bladder after normal urination. To investigate the possible effects of retigabine on bladder function, all participants underwent post-void residual bladder ultrasound at Baseline and during the Maintenance Phase. The PVR bladder ultrasound was performed by a urologist, a qualified ultrasound technician, or a qualified study nurse who was certified to do PVR bladder ultrasound. Change from Baseline in PVR residual volume was calculated as the values at Week 10 and Week 16 minus the value at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a >=7% Increase in Body Weight During Weeks 2 and 4 of theTitration Phase and Weeks 6, 8, 12, and 16 of the Maintenance Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 2 and 4 of Titration Phase and Weeks 6, 8, 12, and 16 of Maintenance Phase
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with recorded weight gain of >=7% over their baseline weight was measured.

intervention.description: Oral tablet. The starting daily dose will be 300 mg/day administered orally in three equally divided doses. This dosage will be increased by 150 mg/day (50 mg/dose) at 1-week intervals (titration phase). At the beginning of Week 3, patients will enter a 12 week maintenance phase.

Oral tablet. The starting daily dose will be 300 mg/day administered orally in three equally divided doses. This dosage will be increased by 150 mg/day (50 mg/dose) at 1-week intervals (titration phase). At the beginning of Week 5, patients will enter a 12 week maintenance phase.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of refractory epilepsy with simple or complex partial onset seizures with or without secondary generalization
- 28-day partial seizure frequency rate of four or more partial seizures over the 8-week baseline phase
- Currently treated with up to three established AEDs
- Vagal Nerve Stimulator may be included
Exclusion Criteria:
- Existing medical or psychiatric condition which could affect patient's health or compromise ability to participate in the study
- Clinically significant abnormalities on physical exam, vital signs, ECG, or liver function tests
- Impaired renal function (creatinine clearance less than 50 mL/minute)
- Evidence of progressive central nervous disease, lesion, or encephalopathy
- History of primary generalized seizures
- History of clustering or flurries or status epilepticus within 12 months of study entry

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants who completed the Double-blind Phase (Titration plus Maintenance Phases) who elected to continue in the Open-Label Extension Study (OLE-S) entered the Transition Phase, for titration, if on placebo, or to maintain the blind if on retigabine. Participants who did not enter the Titration Phase entered a Taper Phase.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 milligrams (mg) and 100 mg were administered orally thrice a day (TID) during the 4-week Titration Phase. Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 12-week Maintenance Phase.

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks. Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the 12-week Maintenance Phase.

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks. Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the 12-week Maintenance Phase.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Participant Did Not Receive Study Drug

group.title: Placebo - Double Blind (DB) Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 milligrams (mg) and 100 mg were administered orally thrice a day (TID) during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Baseline characteristics are summarized for the Safety Population, comprised of all participants who were randomized and received at least one dose of study medication.

Race/Ethnicity, Customized

outcome.title: Percent Change in the 28-day Total Partial Seizure (PS) Frequency From Baseline (BL) to the End of the Double-blind (DB) Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases)
outcome.description: 28-day total PS (PSs [also called focal seizures] are seizures limited to a specific area of the brain) frequency in the BL period = (Number [No.] of total PSs reported in the BL period divided by the No. of days of available total PS data in the BL period) x 28 days. 28-day total PS frequency in the DB period = (No. of total PSs reported in the DB period divided by the No. of days of available total PS data in the DB period) x 28 days. Percent change = ([value in the DB period minus value at BL] divided by the BL value) x 100%. Negative valu es indicate a reduction in seizure frequency.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Week -7 through Week 0), DB Phase (Week 1 through Week 16)
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat Food and Drug Administration (ITT FDA) Population: all randomized participants (P) who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Only participants with post-BL seizure data are included in this analysis.

group.title: Placebo - Double Blind (DB) Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 milligrams (mg) and 100 mg were administered orally thrice a day (TID) during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

measure.title: Percent Change in the 28-day Total Partial Seizure (PS) Frequency From Baseline (BL) to the End of the Double-blind (DB) Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases)
measure.description: 28-day total PS (PSs [also called focal seizures] are seizures limited to a specific area of the brain) frequency in the BL period = (Number [No.] of total PSs reported in the BL period divided by the No. of days of available total PS data in the BL period) x 28 days. 28-day total PS frequency in the DB period = (No. of total PSs reported in the DB period divided by the No. of days of available total PS data in the DB period) x 28 days. Percent change = ([value in the DB period minus value at BL] divided by the BL value) x 100%. Negative valu es indicate a reduction in seizure frequency.

analysis.p_value_desc: Non-parametric rank analysis of covariance adjusted for baseline 28-seizure frequency and stratified by baseline seizure frequency category and region
Non-parametric rank analysis of covariance adjusted for baseline 28-seizure frequency and stratified by baseline seizure frequency category and region

outcome.title: Number of Participants Classified as Responders and Non-responders During the Maintenance Phase
outcome.description: Responders were participants with at least a 50% reduction in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency in the Maintenance Phase as compared to the Baseline period.
outcome.population: ITT European Medicines Evaluation Agency (EMEA) Population: all randomized participants who had received at least 1 dose of study drug in the Maintenance Phase and had at least 1 seizure measurement (whether or not they had a seizure) recorded in the Maintenance Phase.

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

measure.title: Number of Participants With a Reduction in the 28-day Total Partial Seizure Frequency From Baseline to the DB Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases) by Indicated Decile Reduction and Increase Categories
measure.description: Participants who experienced a reduction from Baseline in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency were categorized in decile cutting, i.e., reduction categories of 90-100%, 80-<90%, 70-<80%, 60-<70%, 50-<60%, 40-<50%, 30-<40%, 20-<30%, 10-<20%, >0-<10%, and increase categories of 0-10%, >10-20%, >20-30%, >30% (FDA endpoint). Participants without any post-baseline data were included in the category 0-10% increase category.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With the Indicated Reduction From Baseline in the 28-day Total Partial Seizure Frequency During the Maintenance Phase
outcome.description: Participants who experienced a reduction from Baseline in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency were categorized as having a >75%, a 50-75%, or a <50% reduction, in addition to having no reduction (EMEA endpoint).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Week -7 through Week 0), Week 5 through Week 16

group.title: Placebo - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

measure.title: Number of Participants With the Indicated Reduction From Baseline in the 28-day Total Partial Seizure Frequency During the Maintenance Phase
measure.description: Participants who experienced a reduction from Baseline in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency were categorized as having a >75%, a 50-75%, or a <50% reduction, in addition to having no reduction (EMEA endpoint).

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced the Indicated Level of Exacerbation and Reduction in the 28-day Total Partial Seizure Frequency From Baseline During the Maintenance Phase
outcome.description: Participants who experienced an exacerbation from Baseline in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency were categorized as having a 0-25% or a >25% increase (EMEA endpoint). The number of participants experiencing a >0% reduction from Baseline in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency are also presented.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Week -7 through Week 0), Week 5 through Week 16

group.title: Placebo - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced the Indicated Level of Exacerbation and Reduction in the 28-day Total Partial Seizure Frequency From Baseline During the Maintenance Phase
measure.description: Participants who experienced an exacerbation from Baseline in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency were categorized as having a 0-25% or a >25% increase (EMEA endpoint). The number of participants experiencing a >0% reduction from Baseline in the 28-day total partial seizure frequency are also presented.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Reporting New Seizure Types in the Indicated Categories During the DB Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases) That Were Not Reported at Baseline
outcome.description: New seizure types included those seizures which were not reported by any participant at Baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Week -7 through Week 0), Week 1 through Week 16

group.title: Placebo - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

measure.title: Number of Participants Reporting New Seizure Types in the Indicated Categories During the DB Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases) That Were Not Reported at Baseline
measure.description: New seizure types included those seizures which were not reported by any participant at Baseline.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Were Seizure-free During the DB Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases)
outcome.description: Participants were considered to be seizure-free if they had not reported any seizures during the DB treatment period (Weeks 1-18). For a participant to be seizure free during the DB Phase, the participant had to be seizure free both Week 7 to Week 18 and Week 1 to Week 6. A participant could be seizure free Week 7 to Week 18 (during the Maintenance Phase), but not seizure free Week 1 to Week 6. Hence, there are fewer participants being reported as seizure free from Week 1 to Week 18 than from Week 7 to Week 18.
outcome.population: ITT FDA Population. Only participants with post-baseline seizure data were included in the analysis.

group.title: Placebo - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Were Seizure-free During the DB Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases)
measure.description: Participants were considered to be seizure-free if they had not reported any seizures during the DB treatment period (Weeks 1-18). For a participant to be seizure free during the DB Phase, the participant had to be seizure free both Week 7 to Week 18 and Week 1 to Week 6. A participant could be seizure free Week 7 to Week 18 (during the Maintenance Phase), but not seizure free Week 1 to Week 6. Hence, there are fewer participants being reported as seizure free from Week 1 to Week 18 than from Week 7 to Week 18.
measure.population: ITT FDA Population. Only participants with post-baseline seizure data were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Were Seizure-free During the Maintenance Phase
outcome.description: Participants were considered to be seizure-free if they had not reported any seizures during the Maintenance Phase.

group.title: Placebo - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Were Seizure-free During the Maintenance Phase
measure.description: Participants were considered to be seizure-free if they had not reported any seizures during the Maintenance Phase.

outcome.title: Percentage of Seizure-free Days During the DB Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases)
outcome.description: A seizure-free day was a day without any seizures. For a participant to be seizure free during the DB Phase, the participant had to be seizure free both Week 7 to Week 18 and Week 1 to Week 6. A participant could be seizure free Week 7 to Week 18 (during the Maintenance Phase), but not seizure free Week 1 to Week 6. Hence, there are fewer participants being reported as seizure free from Week 1 to Week 18 than from Week 7 to Week 18. The percentage of seizure-free days was calculated as the total number of days without seizures in the DB period divided by the number of days in DB period x 100%.
outcome.population: ITT FDA Population. Only participants who had post-baseline seizure data were included in the analysis.

group.title: Placebo - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

measure.title: Percentage of Seizure-free Days During the DB Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases)
measure.description: A seizure-free day was a day without any seizures. For a participant to be seizure free during the DB Phase, the participant had to be seizure free both Week 7 to Week 18 and Week 1 to Week 6. A participant could be seizure free Week 7 to Week 18 (during the Maintenance Phase), but not seizure free Week 1 to Week 6. Hence, there are fewer participants being reported as seizure free from Week 1 to Week 18 than from Week 7 to Week 18. The percentage of seizure-free days was calculated as the total number of days without seizures in the DB period divided by the number of days in DB period x 100%.
measure.population: ITT FDA Population. Only participants who had post-baseline seizure data were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Seizure-free Days During the Maintenance Phase
outcome.description: A seizure-free day was a day without any seizures. The percentage of seizure-free days was calculated as the total number of days without seizures in the Maintenance Phase divided by the number of days in the Maintenance Phase x 100%.

group.title: Placebo - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

measure.title: Percentage of Seizure-free Days During the Maintenance Phase
measure.description: A seizure-free day was a day without any seizures. The percentage of seizure-free days was calculated as the total number of days without seizures in the Maintenance Phase divided by the number of days in the Maintenance Phase x 100%.

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) Score at the End of the Maintenance Phase
outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression of Improvement (CGI-I) is a 7-point scale that requires the clinician to assess how much the participant's illness has improved or worsened relative to a baseline state at the beginning of the treatment. Scores on the scale are rated as: 1, very much improved; 2, much improved; 3, minimally improved; 4, no change; 5, minimally worse; 6, much worse; or 7, very much worse.

group.title: Placebo - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

measure.title: Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) Score at the End of the Maintenance Phase
measure.description: Clinical Global Impression of Improvement (CGI-I) is a 7-point scale that requires the clinician to assess how much the participant's illness has improved or worsened relative to a baseline state at the beginning of the treatment. Scores on the scale are rated as: 1, very much improved; 2, much improved; 3, minimally improved; 4, no change; 5, minimally worse; 6, much worse; or 7, very much worse.

outcome.title: Patient Global Impression (PGI) Score at the End of the Maintenance Phase
outcome.description: PGI is a participant-rated scale of improvement that was administered at the end of the Maintenance Phase in order to assess the participant's impression of his or her own improvement. PGI assessments were scored using a 7-point scale: 1, very much improved; 2, much improved; 3, minimally improved; 4, no change; 5, minimally worse; 6, much worse; or 7, very much worse.
outcome.population: ITT EMEA Population. Only participants with post-baseline PGI scores were included in the analysis.

group.title: Placebo - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

measure.title: Patient Global Impression (PGI) Score at the End of the Maintenance Phase
measure.description: PGI is a participant-rated scale of improvement that was administered at the end of the Maintenance Phase in order to assess the participant's impression of his or her own improvement. PGI assessments were scored using a 7-point scale: 1, very much improved; 2, much improved; 3, minimally improved; 4, no change; 5, minimally worse; 6, much worse; or 7, very much worse.
measure.population: ITT EMEA Population. Only participants with post-baseline PGI scores were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Quality of Life Assessed by Quality of Life in Epilepsy-Problems Questionnaire (QOLIE-31-P) at BL (Week 0) and Weeks 4, 8, and 16
outcome.description: The QOLIE-31-P is a 31-item questionnaire evaluating a participant's QOL perception in 7 domains: seizure worry, emotional well being, energy/fatigue, cognitive functioning, medication effects, social functioning, overall QOL. Precoded numeric values for some domains are such that a higher number reflects a more favorable health state; others are such that a higher number reflects a less favorable state. Precoded values are first converted to 0-100 point scores; higher converted scores always reflect better QOL. The overall score is derived by weighting and then summing the 7 domain scores.
outcome.population: Safety Population: all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of retigabine or placebo. Only participants with QOLIE-31-P data were included in the analysis.

group.title: Placebo - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

measure.title: Quality of Life Assessed by Quality of Life in Epilepsy-Problems Questionnaire (QOLIE-31-P) at BL (Week 0) and Weeks 4, 8, and 16
measure.description: The QOLIE-31-P is a 31-item questionnaire evaluating a participant's QOL perception in 7 domains: seizure worry, emotional well being, energy/fatigue, cognitive functioning, medication effects, social functioning, overall QOL. Precoded numeric values for some domains are such that a higher number reflects a more favorable health state; others are such that a higher number reflects a less favorable state. Precoded values are first converted to 0-100 point scores; higher converted scores always reflect better QOL. The overall score is derived by weighting and then summing the 7 domain scores.
measure.population: Safety Population: all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of retigabine or placebo. Only participants with QOLIE-31-P data were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Whose Clinical Laboratory Values Were Deemed an Adverse Event by the Investigator (>=2% in Any Treatment Arm)
outcome.description: Clinically important changes in laboratory values were to be reported as an adverse event if they met one of the following criteria: (1) intervention required; (2) change in dose of study drug required; (3) other treatment/therapy required; (4) association with other diagnoses.

group.title: Placebo - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

group.title: Placebo - Transition Phase
group.description: Participants receiving placebo during the Maintenance Phase were titrated to a target dose of retigabine 300 mg TID during the 4-week Transition Phase in a double-dummy, double-blind manner using a transition kit consisting of retigabine and placebo tablets (50 mg and 100 mg). The starting dose for retigabine titration was 100 mg TID and was increased weekly by a maximum of 150 mg per day

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - Transition Phase
group.description: Participants receiving retigabine 200 mg TID during the Maintenance Phase were titrated to a target dose of 300 mg TID retigabine during the 4-week Transition Phase in a double-dummy, double-blind manner using a transition kit consisting of retigabine and placebo tablets (50 mg and 100 mg). Retigabine doses were increased weekly by a maximum of 150 mg per day

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - Transition Phase
group.description: Participants receiving retigabine 300 mg TID during the Maintenance Phase continued receiving retigabine 300 mg TID during the 4-week Transition Phase in a double-dummy, double-blind manner using a transition kit consisting of retigabine and placebo tablets (50 mg and 100 mg). Placebo doses were administered to maintain the blinding and were increased weekly by a maximum of 150 mg per day

measure.title: Number of Participants Whose Clinical Laboratory Values Were Deemed an Adverse Event by the Investigator (>=2% in Any Treatment Arm)
measure.description: Clinically important changes in laboratory values were to be reported as an adverse event if they met one of the following criteria: (1) intervention required; (2) change in dose of study drug required; (3) other treatment/therapy required; (4) association with other diagnoses.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Reported the Indicated Renal and Urinary Disorder Adverse Events at a Frequency Threshold of 2% (in Any Treatment Arm)
outcome.description: A summary of the adverse events classified as renal or urinary disorders and in which at least 2% (rounded to an integer) of participants in any treatment arm reported during the study is presented.

group.title: Placebo - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

group.title: Placebo - Transition Phase
group.description: Participants receiving placebo during the Maintenance Phase were titrated to a target dose of retigabine 300 mg TID during the 4-week Transition Phase in a double-dummy, double-blind manner using a transition kit consisting of retigabine and placebo tablets (50 mg and 100 mg). The starting dose for retigabine titration was 100 mg TID and was increased weekly by a maximum of 150 mg per day

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - Transition Phase
group.description: Participants receiving retigabine 200 mg TID during the Maintenance Phase were titrated to a target dose of 300 mg TID retigabine during the 4-week Transition Phase in a double-dummy, double-blind manner using a transition kit consisting of retigabine and placebo tablets (50 mg and 100 mg). Retigabine doses were increased weekly by a maximum of 150 mg per day

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - Transition Phase
group.description: Participants receiving retigabine 300 mg TID during the Maintenance Phase continued receiving retigabine 300 mg TID during the 4-week Transition Phase in a double-dummy, double-blind manner using a transition kit consisting of retigabine and placebo tablets (50 mg and 100 mg). Placebo doses were administered to maintain the blinding and were increased weekly by a maximum of 150 mg per day

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Reported the Indicated Renal and Urinary Disorder Adverse Events at a Frequency Threshold of 2% (in Any Treatment Arm)
measure.description: A summary of the adverse events classified as renal or urinary disorders and in which at least 2% (rounded to an integer) of participants in any treatment arm reported during the study is presented.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Post-void Residual Urine Volume at Weeks 8 and 16 of the Maintenance Phase
outcome.description: Post-void residual (PVR) urine refers to the amount of urine remaining in the bladder after normal urination. To investigate the possible effects of retigabine on bladder function, all participants underwent post-void residual bladder ultrasound at Baseline and during the Maintenance Phase. The PVR bladder ultrasound was performed by a urologist, a qualified ultrasound technician, or a qualified study nurse who was certified to do PVR bladder ultrasound. Change from Baseline in PVR residual volume was calculated as the values at Week 10 and Week 16 minus the value at Baseline.
outcome.population: Safety Population. Only participants who remained in the study at the indicated week and who also had a PVR assessment were analyzed.

group.title: Placebo: Maintenance Phase
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 mg and 100 mg were administered orally TID during the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID: Maintenance Phase
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID: Maintenance Phase
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the 12-week Maintenance Phase

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Post-void Residual Urine Volume at Weeks 8 and 16 of the Maintenance Phase
measure.description: Post-void residual (PVR) urine refers to the amount of urine remaining in the bladder after normal urination. To investigate the possible effects of retigabine on bladder function, all participants underwent post-void residual bladder ultrasound at Baseline and during the Maintenance Phase. The PVR bladder ultrasound was performed by a urologist, a qualified ultrasound technician, or a qualified study nurse who was certified to do PVR bladder ultrasound. Change from Baseline in PVR residual volume was calculated as the values at Week 10 and Week 16 minus the value at Baseline.
measure.population: Safety Population. Only participants who remained in the study at the indicated week and who also had a PVR assessment were analyzed.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With a >=7% Increase in Body Weight During Weeks 2 and 4 of theTitration Phase and Weeks 6, 8, 12, and 16 of the Maintenance Phase
outcome.description: The number of participants with recorded weight gain of >=7% over their baseline weight was measured.
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 2 and 4 of Titration Phase and Weeks 6, 8, 12, and 16 of Maintenance Phase
outcome.population: Safety Population. Only participants who remained in the study at the indicated week and who also had a body weight assessment were analyzed.

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

measure.title: Number of Participants With a >=7% Increase in Body Weight During Weeks 2 and 4 of theTitration Phase and Weeks 6, 8, 12, and 16 of the Maintenance Phase
measure.description: The number of participants with recorded weight gain of >=7% over their baseline weight was measured.
measure.population: Safety Population. Only participants who remained in the study at the indicated week and who also had a body weight assessment were analyzed.

group.title: Placebo - Double Blind (DB) Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Matching placebo tablets of dummy strengths of 50 milligrams (mg) and 100 mg were administered orally thrice a day (TID) during the 4-week Titration Phase and the 12-week Maintenance Phase

group.title: Placebo - Transition Phase
group.description: Participants receiving placebo during the Maintenance Phase were titrated to a target dose of retigabine 300 mg TID during the 4-week Transition Phase in a double-dummy, double-blind manner using a transition kit consisting of retigabine and placebo tablets (50 mg and 100 mg). The starting dose for retigabine titration was 100 mg TID and was increased weekly by a maximum of 150 mg per day

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 200 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 600 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 200 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 200 mg TID - Transition Phase
group.description: Participants receiving retigabine 200 mg TID during the Maintenance Phase were titrated to a target dose of 300 mg TID retigabine during the 4-week Transition Phase in a double-dummy, double-blind manner using a transition kit consisting of retigabine and placebo tablets (50 mg and 100 mg). Retigabine doses were increased weekly by a maximum of 150 mg per day

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - DB Phase (Titration Plus Maintenance)
group.description: Retigabine 50 mg and 100 mg tablets were administered orally for a target dose of 300 mg TID during the Titration Phase, during which participants were titrated from 300 mg per day to 900 mg per day with weekly increases in doses of 150 mg per day over the course of 2 to 4 weeks, followed by a 12-week Maintenance Phase, during which participants were administered 300 mg TID

group.title: Retigabine 300 mg TID - Transition Phase
group.description: Participants receiving retigabine 300 mg TID during the Maintenance Phase continued receiving retigabine 300 mg TID during the 4-week Transition Phase in a double-dummy, double-blind manner using a transition kit consisting of retigabine and placebo tablets (50 mg and 100 mg). Placebo doses were administered to maintain the blinding and were increased weekly by a maximum of 150 mg per day

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Mood disorder due to a general medical condition

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
